verses.verse: The word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068> that came to Joel <WH3100> the son <WH1121> of Pethuel <WH6602>.

Hear <WH8085> this, ye old men <WH2205>, and give ear <WH238>, all ye inhabitants <WH3427> of the land <WH776>. Hath this been in your days <WH3117>, or even <WH518> in the days <WH3117> of your fathers <WH1>?
Tell <WH5608> ye your children <WH1121> of it, and let your children <WH1121> tell their children <WH1121>, and their children <WH1121> another <WH312> generation <WH1755>.

That which the palmerworm <WH1501> hath left <WH3499> hath the locust <WH697> eaten <WH398>; and that which the locust <WH697> hath left <WH3499> hath the cankerworm <WH3218> eaten <WH398>; and that which the cankerworm <WH3218> hath left <WH3499> hath the caterpiller <WH2625> eaten <WH398>.

Awake <WH6974>, ye drunkards <WH7910>, and weep <WH1058>; and howl <WH3213>, all ye drinkers <WH8354> of wine <WH3196>, because of the new wine <WH6071>; for it is cut off <WH3772> from your mouth <WH6310>.

For a nation <WH1471> is come up <WH5927> upon my land <WH776>, strong <WH6099>, and without number <WH4557>, whose teeth <WH8127> are the teeth <WH8127> of a lion <WH738>, and he hath the cheek teeth <WH4973> of a great lion <WH3833>.

He hath laid <WH7760> my vine <WH1612> waste <WH8047>, and barked <WH7111> my fig tree <WH8384>: he hath made it clean <WH2834> bare <WH2834>, and cast it away <WH7993>; the branches <WH8299> thereof are made white <WH3835>.
¶ Lament <WH421> like a virgin <WH1330> girded <WH2296> with sackcloth <WH8242> for the husband <WH1167> of her youth <WH5271>.

The meat offering <WH4503> and the drink offering <WH5262> is cut off <WH3772> from the house <WH1004> of the LORD <WH3068>; the priests <WH3548>, the LORD's <WH3068> ministers <WH8334>, mourn <WH56>.
The field <WH7704> is wasted <WH7703>, the land <WH127> mourneth <WH56>; for the corn <WH1715> is wasted <WH7703>: the new wine <WH8492> is dried up <WH3001>, the oil <WH3323> languisheth <WH535>.

Be ye ashamed <WH3001>, O ye husbandmen <WH406>; howl <WH3213>, O ye vinedressers <WH3755>, for the wheat <WH2406> and for the barley <WH8184>; because the harvest <WH7105> of the field <WH7704> is perished <WH6>.

The vine <WH1612> is dried up <WH3001>, and the fig tree <WH8384> languisheth <WH535>; the pomegranate <WH7416> tree, the palm tree <WH8558> also, and the apple tree <WH8598>, even all the trees <WH6086> of the field <WH7704>, are withered <WH3001>: because joy <WH8342> is withered away <WH3001> from the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120>.

Gird <WH2296> yourselves, and lament <WH5594>, ye priests <WH3548>: howl <WH3213>, ye ministers <WH8334> of the altar <WH4196>: come <WH935>, lie all night <WH3885> in sackcloth <WH8242>, ye ministers <WH8334> of my God <WH430>: for the meat offering <WH4503> and the drink offering <WH5262> is withholden <WH4513> from the house <WH1004> of your God <WH430>.

¶ Sanctify <WH6942> ye a fast <WH6685>, call <WH7121> a solemn assembly <WH6116>, gather <WH622> the elders <WH2205> and all the inhabitants <WH3427> of the land <WH776> into the house <WH1004> of the LORD <WH3068> your God <WH430>, and cry <WH2199> unto the LORD <WH3068>,
Alas <WH162> for the day <WH3117>! for the day <WH3117> of the LORD <WH3068> is at hand <WH7138>, and as a destruction <WH7701> from the Almighty <WH7706> shall it come <WH935>.
Is not the meat <WH400> cut off <WH3772> before our eyes <WH5869>, yea, joy <WH8057> and gladness <WH1524> from the house <WH1004> of our God <WH430>?

The seed <WH6507> is rotten <WH5685> under their clods <WH4053>, the garners <WH214> are laid desolate <WH8074>, the barns <WH4460> are broken down <WH2040>; for the corn <WH1715> is withered <WH3001>.

How do the beasts <WH929> groan <WH584>! the herds <WH5739> of cattle <WH1241> are perplexed <WH943>, because they have no pasture <WH4829>; yea, the flocks <WH5739> of sheep <WH6629> are made desolate <WH816>.

O LORD <WH3068>, to thee will I cry <WH7121>: for the fire <WH784> hath devoured <WH398> the pastures <WH4999> of the wilderness <WH4057>, and the flame <WH3852> hath burned <WH3857> all the trees <WH6086> of the field <WH7704>.

The beasts <WH929> of the field <WH7704> cry <WH6165> also unto thee: for the rivers <WH650> of waters <WH4325> are dried up <WH3001>, and the fire <WH784> hath devoured <WH398> the pastures <WH4999> of the wilderness <WH4057>.
